plausible_answers.text: used the Internet to present its content

qas.question: What had the festival not done for the past three years when the statement by Cara Cusumano was made?
It was the last year of Tribeca featuring a showcase of producers who do what?
What behavior is just done by people who want content for free?

context: Cara Cusumano, director of the Tribeca Film Festival, stated in April 2014: "Piracy is less about people not wanting to pay and more about just wanting the <a0_0><b4_0><b5_0>immediacy<b5_0/><b4_0/><a0_0/> – people saying, 'I want to watch Spiderman right now' and downloading it". The statement occurred during the third year that the festival <a1_0><b6_0>used the Internet to present its content<b6_0/><a1_0/>, while it was the first year that it featured a showcase of content producers who <a2_0><b7_0>work exclusively online<b7_0/><a2_0/>. Cusumano further explained that <a3_0><b8_0>downloading<b8_0/><a3_0/> behavior is not merely conducted by people who merely want to obtain content for free:
